newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: ABB in $270 mln U.K. power order.
newsitem.headline: ABB in $270 mln U.K. power order.

text.p: ABB Asea Brown Boveri AG said it had received a $270 million contract from Humber Power Ltd for a 510-megawatt power plant to extend an existing power station in Britain.
ABB said in a statement it was one of several co-owners of Humber Power, an independent power producer.
It said construction of the extension to South Humber Bank power station would start in early 1997 and commercial operation was due to start by the end of 1998.

ABB will be the turnkey supplier for the extension, a combined-cycle plant with two gas turbines, heat recovery steam generators, one steam turbine, electrical generators and an overall control system.
ABB said it would also be responsible for all auxiliary systems, overall design, engineering and project management. -- Zurich Newsroom, +41-1-631 7340
